required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Curcumin in Treating Patients With Familial Adenomatous Polyposis
clinical_study.official_title: Curcumin for Treatment of Intestinal Adenomas in Familial Adenomatous Polyposis (FAP)

brief_summary.textblock: This randomized phase II trial studies curcumin in treating patients with familial adenomatous polyposis. Curcumin may prevent colorectal cancer in patients with a history of rectal polyps or colorectal neoplasia.

detailed_description.textblock:
Specific Aims:
I. To determine in a randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled study the tolerability and effectiveness of curcumin to regress intestinal adenomas by measuring duodenal and colorectal/ileal polyp number, and polyp size in familial adenomatous polyposis patients with intact colons, ileorectal anastomosis surgery, or ileo-anal pullthrough (reservoir) surgery.
II. To measure markers of cell proliferation including colorectal mucosal levels of ornithine decarboxylase (ODC), polyamines, mucosal deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) methylation, proliferative index (Ki67 antiproliferative cell nuclear antibody), apoptosis index, vascular density, mucosal prostaglandin, leukotriene levels, and activation of the nuclear factor kappa B (NFKB), and v-akt murine thymoma viral oncogene homolog 1 (Akt) survival pathways.
OUTLINE: Patients are randomized to 1 of 2 treatment arms.
Arm I: Patients receive curcumin orally (PO) twice daily (BID) for 12 months.
Arm II: Patients receive placebo PO BID for 12 months.
After completion of study treatment, patients are followed up at 4 months.

primary_outcome.description: Average number of polyps in the placebo arm at the end of the study is compared to the average in the curcumin arm

secondary_outcome.description: Mean size of the 5 largest polyps

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Decrease in Polyp Burden at 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: The polyp burden as evaluated by video tape review. Polyp burden at 12 months compared to time 0 for each participant and counting participants with decrease in polyp burden at 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Grade >=2 Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Events were graded as follows: Grade 0= no adverse event or within normal limits; Grade 1= mild adverse event (causing no limitations of usual activity); Grade 2= moderate adverse event (causing some limitation of activity); Grade 3= severe adverse event (severe and undesirable; causing inability to carry out usual activities; Grade 4= life threatening or disabling adverse event; Grade 5= fatal adverse event.

Medication compliance of the participant= number of capsules taken divided by the number of capsules prescribed as determined by pill count and described as a percentage per participant. Then the compliance of each participant in the assigned group (curcumin or placebo) was averaged together to obtain the medication compliance rate of that group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Ornithine Decarboxylase (ODC) Activity Levels
secondary_outcome.description: Change in ODC mean activity levels (expressed as nmol of activity/mg of mucosal tissue/hr) at 8 months compared to baseline (time 0)
Polyamine mean level changes (expressed as pg/mg protein) at month 8-baseline
Change in MicroRNA mean activity level at 8 months compared to baseline (time 0)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Spermidine/Spermine N-1 Acetyl Transferase (SSAT)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in SSAT mean activity level at 8 months compared to baseline (time 0)
Change in SMOX mean activity level at 8 months compared to baseline (time 0)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Ki-67 Anti-proliferative Cell Nuclear Antibody Index Levels
secondary_outcome.description: Change in cellular proliferation rate was measured by assessment of Ki-67 anti-proliferative cell nuclear antibody index levels at 8 months
Change in apoptosis index levels at 8 months by assessing cleaved Caspase-3 measurement

other_outcome.measure: Change in Mucosal DNA Methylation Levels.

other_outcome.description: Patients withdrawn from study due to increasing polyp burden and/or advancing histology.

other_outcome.measure: Activation of NFKB (Nuclear Factor Kappa-light-chain-enhancer of Activated B Cells) Pathway

arm_group.description: Patients receive curcumin PO BID for 12 months. Laboratory Biomarker Analysis
Patients receive placebo PO BID for 12 months. Laboratory Biomarker Analysis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with familial adenomatous polyposis who have undergone subtotal colectomy with ileorectal anastomosis, total colectomy with ileo-anal pull through (reservoir), and patients with intact colons with 5 or more adenomas in the rectum-sigmoid or reservoir
- Patients with familial adenomatous polyposis (FAP) and duodenal adenomatous polyposis without current lower tract adenomatous polyposis i.e. status/post (s/p) ileostomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Female patients of childbearing age not on effective birth control
- Pregnant women
- White blood cell count (WBC) < 3500/ml
- Platelet count < 100,000/ml
- Blood urea nitrogen (BUN) > 25mg%
- Creatinine > 1.5mg%
- Patients unable to stop non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), aspirin, curcumin, tumeric, calcium, vitamin D, green tea, or polyphenol E supplements for the duration of the trial
- Malignancy other than nonmelanoma skin cancer
- Active bacterial infection
- Patients with symptoms of active gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) (symptomatic despite medication or current erosive esophagitis on endoscopy)
- Patients with a history of peptic ulcer disease
- Patients on warfarin or plavix

overall_official.affiliation: Johns Hopkins University/Sidney Kimmel Cancer Center

facility.name: Johns Hopkins University/Sidney Kimmel Cancer Center

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were screened and enrolled at the Johns Hopkins Hospital and the University of Puerto Rico Hospital.

reported_events.time_frame: Reported adverse events (AE) included events starting on or after day 0 and on or before month 16.
reported_events.desc: If a subject experienced more than 1 of a given AE the subject is counted only once for that AE. If a subject experienced more than 1 AE in a system organ class the subject is only counted once.

group.title: Arm I (Curcumin)
group.description: Patients receive curcumin PO BID for 12 months. Curcumin: Given PO

group.title: Arm II (Placebo)
group.description: Patients receive placebo PO BID for 12 months. Placebo: Given PO

event.description: Subject developed appendicitis unrelated to study drug.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
